required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PMS Retrospective Study of WIRION Performance in Patients Undergoing Saphenous Vein Graft (SVG) Intervention
clinical_study.official_title: Post Marketing Surveillance (PMS) Retrospective Study of WIRION Performance in Patients Undergoing Saphenous Vein Graft (SVG) Intervention

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to collect data on the use of the WIRION system in Patients undergoing Percutaneous Intervention of Saphenous Vein Graft (SVG).

detailed_description.textblock: WIRION system is used as protection device in patients undergoing SVG stenting procedure. This retrospective study collects data on the usability of the WIRION during the procedure.

primary_outcome.measure: Collecting data on the use of the WIRION system in patients undergoing SVG stenting. Collected data includes device performance during procedure and AE/SAE records during procedure and 30 days following procedure.

intervention.description: Opening and stenting of blocked SVG with the use of the WIRION embolic protection filter

study_pop.textblock: patients undergoing percutaneous intervention (PI) of saphenous vein graft (SVG) stenting

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients underwent percutaneous intervention (PI) of SVG stenting in which the WIRIONTM system was used.
- Patient is greater than or equal to 18 years of age.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Undergone cardiac surgery in the past 60 days before the procedure.
